themes: perceived lack of genuine support for arts
community division due to funding practices
favoritism toward wealthy or politically connected groups
failure to follow established policies and commitments
key_phrases: Austin likes to pat itself on the back for how supportive they are for the arts. It's a myth.
Artists and the arts community have to fight and scratch for any support, any funding, any cooperation and coordination, and any public awareness.
Stop the back slapping and come up with creative ways to provide support that don't divide the community.
Stop catering to any particular group, whether they have lots of money or political weight
follow the policies and commitments that have been developed over the years with real input, real consultants, and real results.
barriers_identified: competition for limited support and funding
favoritism toward wealthy or politically influential groups
solutions_proposed: come up with creative ways to provide support that don't divide the community
stop catering to any particular group
follow the policies and commitments that have been developed over the years
